text: » Flat muscular tube that runs from laryngopharynx to stomach — Is collapsed when not involved in food propulsion » Pierces diaphragm at esophageal hiatus Joins stomach at cardial orifice « Gastroesophageal (cardiac) sphincter surrounds cardial orifice — Keeps orifice closed when food is not being swallowed — Mucus cells on both sides of sphincter help protect esophagus from acid reflux
